titleStmt.title: A short account of the latter end and dying words of Francis Howgil, who dyed a prisoner for the testimony of Jesus, in Appulby the twentieth day of the eleaventh moneth, 1668
titleStmt.author: Bolton, John, 1599-1679.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
Signed and dated at end: Appulby, the 20th of the 12th moneth, 1688. John Bolton of Bongale in Westmoreland, Edward Guy [et al.]
